body_html:
@while2 Thank you for the workaround.
@DucVuMinh

    train_graph_location = '/tmp/tensorflow_logs/
    train_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter(graph_location) #Save tensorboard variables
    test_graph_location = tempfile.mkdtemp()
    test_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter(location)

If you print both the locations, you will get

/tmp/tensorflow_logs/train    #location of train_writer
/tmp/tmp82i59t                    #test_writer

While loading tensorboard,
tensorboard --logdir=/tmp/

You shoud be able to see two graphs(different colors ) plotted on the same plot.

body:
@while2  Thank you for the workaround.
@DucVuMinh 

```
    train_graph_location = '/tmp/tensorflow_logs/
    train_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter(graph_location) #Save tensorboard variables
    test_graph_location = tempfile.mkdtemp()
    test_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter(location)

```
If you print both the locations, you will get
```
/tmp/tensorflow_logs/train    #location of train_writer
/tmp/tmp82i59t                    #test_writer
```
While loading tensorboard,
`tensorboard --logdir=/tmp/`

You shoud be able to see two graphs(different colors ) plotted on the same plot.
